newsitem.title: FINLAND: MOST FINNISH SMES SEE NO NEAR TERM FINANCING NEEDS.
newsitem.headline: MOST FINNISH SMES SEE NO NEAR TERM FINANCING NEEDS.

text.p: Over 70 percent of small- and medium-sized companies (SMEs) have no need of external financing in the near term despite increasing investment, the Finnish Entrepreneurs' lobby Suomen Yrittajat said on Thursday.
"In spite of increasing investment, over 70 percent of companies do not see any need of external financing in the near future," the lobby said in a statement.
It referred to a poll made in spring 1997 among 1,340 SMEs, each with less than 200 employees.
One third of the companies polled represented the trade sector, one third industry and construction and one third the service sector, Suomen Yrittajat said.
